div.p: Lake Superior School District #381 1640 Hwy 2 Two Harbors, MN 55616 Phone: 218-834-8201 Fax: 218-834-8239

div.div: Proudly Serving The Communities Of Two Harbors And Silver Bay, Minnesota

li.a: KIDS & Co: School Age Child Care

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-page-ancestor menu-item-has-children menu-item-18

li.a: Contacts (For Use Only By Internal Staff)
Clever Login for IXL and Mastery Connect

div.p: Starting March 30, 2020, we will be starting our distance learning period. During this time food service will still be available for all children 18 and under. As the school changes from four to five days, we will also be providing food for five days a week during the distance learning period (excluding April 10, 2020*).
We will be providing ‘Grab & Go’ style meals to children at eight (8) sites throughout our district during the hours of 9am-11am.

ul.li: Claire Nelson Community Center Parking Lot (Finland)
Knife River Rec Center Parking Lot (Knife River)
Duluth Township Hall Lower Parking Lot off Homestead (Duluth Township)

div.p: Meals each day will contain food for breakfast, lunch and a snack for each child.

If children have a specific allergy, please notify the staff handing out the food as separate items will be available for those individuals. The meal options are each at the Kitchen Managers discretion – following meal requirements and inventory on hand.
Families that lack transportation or have a child that is medically fragile, please contact your local school administrative assistant to sign up for meal delivery.

*On April 10, 2020, our food service program will be unavailable for the day. Our staff will be preparing and handing out two meals on Thursday, April 9 for students to pickup in preparation of that Friday’s closure.

a.title: Lake Superior Spelling Bee The Lake Superior School District held its annual spelling bee on January 9th. Students representing grades 5 through 8 from each building participated. The Bee is registered with Scripps National Spelling Bee. The final 3 spellers from the district Bee are invited to participate in the regional Bee held in Mountain Iron on February 6th. Winners at the region Bee advance to the multi-region Bee. This year's winners were champion Peter Jonson, 2nd place Anja Olsen, and third place Emily Peterson. Students from all 3 buildings in the district participated. Special thank you to the North Shore Federal Credit Union for sponsoring the Bee and providing prizes for the winners. Congratulations to the winning spellers
